Articles.Content:
Here is my current project fellow Kerbanauts. I'll start with the problem, its explodes when leaving kerbins atmosphere, the third one.

Its built as three main stages. Main booster rockets to get it into orbit on the bottom. 2nd stage to break kerbins orbit and get it to the moon. Final one for landing. I think I will have enough fuel, my only problem is the exploding bit. Already made a lot of adjustments, even learnt to move the centre of mass away from weak structural parts. Right now i'm at a loss as to what to do.

Its meant to be the beginning of a munbase refuelling depot. Some of its parts are missing, they be sent later on. Anyone had similar experiences with stuff exploding at this altitude and managed to fix it? if so how did you do it?

Edited July 28, 2013 by Moonfrog

You're probably going too fast and crushing your ship against the atmosphere. In the Wiki you can look up Kerbin and see the "maximum" speeds at different elevations. Also, if you look at the end of flight summary, you can see which connection failed and fix that. But if you're going too fast, usually another part will then fail instead. Also, if those are 7 Mainsails, you're almost certainly going too fast if you're not throttled down.

Edited July 27, 2013 by Gus
Hit F3 the moment things look odd, see what part failed and fix it.
Mainsails on jumbo tanks overheat and explode. Add smaller tanks underneath the orange ones, or just throttle down to about 60% when they start to overheat.

After reading thee wiki and your posts, its possible its speed, though i'm not sure why. The part of the atmosphere that it explodes at is one just before your in space orbit on the far left of the atmosphere bar. I continue to experiment a litte with throttle. I try to give a better description of the rocket.

It has 7 mainsails that fire at launch. These are set up, I like to call it spiral fuel link set up, or S link set up, so the fuel looks like an S. Everyone else calls it asparagus or something. After doing it again, and it exploded again. The rocket seems to explode after 6 of the outer jumbo orange tanks and their engines have been decoupled. The rocket is only firing on the one mainsail at about 80% thrust to prevent overheating. The reason for me using mainsails is because the original design, using quad engine part, it lacked the thrust to take off properly. The 2nd stage part used to be twice as big, but I cut its fuel in half and reduced the side engine tanks to smaller ones as u can see in the first post, were roco max ones to begin with.

Seems to explode with all radial tanks are dropped of on the launch stage. Thx for your answers I try stopping my acceleration at one point, it does start to increase quite rapidly when I break through the atmosphere so it could be that as some of u have said.

After flying at lower speeds, the rocket successfully did not explode, so it seems you guys were right about the speeds. I kept it between 150ms and under 200ms below 10,000, and under 300ms for next part, it seemed to work fine. Unfortunately it doesn't have enough fuel to get into orbit.

That is my next problem, I would like to ask this of you guys. I have an idea, but was wondering if u guys also had ideas on how to lift the munbase part into orbit. Heres the new idea I came up with before I go to sleep, maybe u can tell me if its worth it or not, cos it sounds complicated.

I plan on splitting the jumbo tanks that are radially attached into 2 rings of the half sized fuel tanks. Then I plan to attach a fuel line going from top ring too the bottom ring. Then decoupling the top ring fuel tanks when they become empty in the same order as u would do in spiral/asparagus style. Idea being that I can jettison half the jumbo half and maybe be more fuel efficient and get it into orbit. I might have to use sepatrons, I fiddle with it if u guys think its worth it.

Also be grateful for any rocket ideas u can think of that might help.
send it up part by part and dock together in munar orbit or on surface

Jettisoning fuel tanks mounted above the engines definitely presents challenges.

Not a common practice.
I try sending it up part by part as well. thx. at least its not exploding anymore.

Yay I made it. Thx to all your suggestions. heres a screenshot of the new modified version on the mun, several attempts of it rolling down the hill till I discovered the brake button.

thx again.
